alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Kershaw; Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 9:38PM EST until further notice by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Lexington, Richland and Calhoun Counties. Pee Dee River At Cheraw affecting Chesterfield and Marlboro Counties. Saluda River At Chappells affecting Saluda, Newberry and Greenwood Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Richland and Calhoun Counties. Stevens Creek Near Modoc affecting Edgefield and McCormick Counties. Enoree River At Whitmire affecting Newberry and Union Counties. Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Lancaster, Kershaw and Fairfield Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wateree River at Lake Wateree. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 100.4 feet, The piers on the Wildlife Road bridge over Singleton Creek become submerged. At 102.5 feet, Roadways near Beaver Creek become flooded. At 103.0 feet, Home owners on low lying property have to move belongings out of basements or from under raised houses. Boat launch on U.S. Highway 1 at the lake closed due to flood water. At 105.0 feet, Roads and homes nearest the lake shore flood. Flooded roads isolate areas extending from the lake shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 97.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 100.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight and continue rising to a crest of 103.0 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 100.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. Wednesday morning at 945 AM EST.
